Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Sapecin B  (natural AMPs; defensins; UCSS1a; 3S=S;  insects,  arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Activity against B. megaterium IAM 1166, B. circulans IFO 3967, C. glutamicum ATCC1 3059 (IC50 <0.2ug/ml), S. aureus ATCC6538B (IC50 1.6 ug/ml), S. epidermidis IFO 3762 (IC50 7.0 ug/ml), S. mutans 6515t (IC50 6.6 ug/ml), S. sanguis ST3t (IC50 3.8 ug/ml), S. salivarius HHTt (IC50 3.5ug/ml) and S. bovis ATCC27960t (IC50 0.9 ug/ml).it also inhibits K+ channel.Chemical modification:   three disulfid bonds.Sequence analysis: Similar to charybdotoxin (CTX) found in scorpion venom.SAR:  Residues 7-17 consist of the antibacterial core segment (Nakajima et al 1997 FEBS Lett 415: 64-66).Updated 4/2019; 9/2024
Literature Information.Author: Yamada K, Natori S.1993
Literature Information.Title: Purification, sequence and antibacterial activity of two novel sapecin homologues from Sarcophaga embryonic cells: similarity of sapecin B to charybdotoxin.
